speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
text_entry: SCENE II. The same. A room in the palace.

speaker: MARCUS ANDRONICUS
text_entry: Enter, from one side, AARON, DEMETRIUS, and  CHIRON; from the other side, Young LUCIUS, and an  Attendant, with a bundle of weapons, and verses writ upon them

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Demetrius, here's the son of Lucius;

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: He hath some message to deliver us.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Ay, some mad message from his mad grandfather.

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: My lords, with all the humbleness I may,

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: I greet your honours from Andronicus.

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: Aside

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: And pray the Roman gods confound you both!

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Gramercy, lovely Lucius: what's the news?

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: [Aside]  That you are both decipher'd, that's the news,

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: For villains mark'd with rape.--May it please you,

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: My grandsire, well advised, hath sent by me

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: The goodliest weapons of his armoury

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: To gratify your honourable youth,

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: The hope of Rome; for so he bade me say;

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: And so I do, and with his gifts present

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: Your lordships, that, whenever you have need,

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: You may be armed and appointed well:

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: And so I leave you both:

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: Aside

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: like bloody villains.

speaker: Young LUCIUS
text_entry: Exeunt Young LUCIUS, and Attendant

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: What's here? A scroll; and written round about?

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Let's see;

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Reads

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: 'Integer vitae, scelerisque purus,

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Non eget Mauri jaculis, nec arcu.'

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: O, 'tis a verse in Horace; I know it well:

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: I read it in the grammar long ago.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Ay, just; a verse in Horace; right, you have it.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Aside

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Now, what a thing it is to be an ass!

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Here's no sound jest! the old man hath found their guilt;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And sends them weapons wrapped about with lines,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: That wound, beyond their feeling, to the quick.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: But were our witty empress well afoot,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: She would applaud Andronicus' conceit:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: But let her rest in her unrest awhile.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And now, young lords, was't not a happy star

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Led us to Rome, strangers, and more than so,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Captives, to be advanced to this height?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: It did me good, before the palace gate

speaker: AARON
text_entry: To brave the tribune in his brother's hearing.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: But me more good, to see so great a lord

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Basely insinuate and send us gifts.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Had he not reason, Lord Demetrius?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Did you not use his daughter very friendly?

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: I would we had a thousand Roman dames

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: At such a bay, by turn to serve our lust.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: A charitable wish and full of love.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Here lacks but your mother for to say amen.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: And that would she for twenty thousand more.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Come, let us go; and pray to all the gods

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: For our beloved mother in her pains.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: [Aside]  Pray to the devils; the gods have given us over.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Trumpets sound within

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Why do the emperor's trumpets flourish thus?

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Belike, for joy the emperor hath a son.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Soft! who comes here?

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Enter a Nurse, with a blackamoor Child in her arms

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Good morr ow, lords:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: O, tell me, did you see Aaron the Moor?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Well, more or less, or ne'er a whit at all,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Here Aaron is; and what with Aaron now?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: O gentle Aaron, we are all undone!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Now help, or woe betide thee evermore!

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Why, what a caterwauling dost thou keep!

speaker: AARON
text_entry: What dost thou wrap and fumble in thine arms?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: O, that which I would hide from heaven's eye,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Our empress' shame, and stately Rome's disgrace!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: She is deliver'd, lords; she is deliver'd.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: To whom?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I mean, she is brought a-bed.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Well, God give her good rest! What hath he sent her?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: A devil.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Why, then she is the devil's dam; a joyful issue.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: A joyless, dismal, black, and sorrowful issue:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Here is the babe, as loathsome as a toad

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Amongst the fairest breeders of our clime:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: The empress sends it thee, thy stamp, thy seal,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: And bids thee christen it with thy dagger's point.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: 'Zounds, ye whore! is black so base a hue?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Sweet blowse, you are a beauteous blossom, sure.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Villain, what hast thou done?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: That which thou canst not undo.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Thou hast undone our mother.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Villain, I have done thy mother.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: And therein, hellish dog, thou hast undone.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Woe to her chance, and damn'd her loathed choice!

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Accursed the offspring of so foul a fiend!

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: It shall not live.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: It shall not die.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Aaron, it must; the mother wills it so.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: What, must it, nurse? then let no man but I

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Do execution on my flesh and blood.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: I'll broach the tadpole on my rapier's point:

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Nurse, give it me; my sword shall soon dispatch it.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Sooner this sword shall plough thy bowels up.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Takes the Child from the Nurse, and draws

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Stay, murderous villains! will you kill your brother?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Now, by the burning tapers of the sky,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: That shone so brightly when this boy was got,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: He dies upon my scimitar's sharp point

speaker: AARON
text_entry: That touches this my first-born son and heir!

speaker: AARON
text_entry: I tell you, younglings, not Enceladus,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: With all his threatening band of Typhon's brood,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Nor great Alcides, nor the god of war,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Shall seize this prey out of his father's hands.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: What, what, ye sanguine, shallow-hearted boys!

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Ye white-limed walls! ye alehouse painted signs!

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Coal-black is better than another hue,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: In that it scorns to bear another hue;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: For all the water in the ocean

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Can never turn the swan's black legs to white,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Although she lave them hourly in the flood.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Tell the empress from me, I am of age

speaker: AARON
text_entry: To keep mine own, excuse it how she can.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Wilt thou betray thy noble mistress thus?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: My mistress is my mistress; this myself,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: The vigour and the picture of my youth:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: This before all the world do I prefer;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: This maugre all the world will I keep safe,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Or some of you shall smoke for it in Rome.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: By this our mother is forever shamed.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Rome will despise her for this foul escape.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: The emperor, in his rage, will doom her death.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: I blush to think upon this ignomy.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Why, there's the privilege your beauty bears:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Fie, treacherous hue, that will betray with blushing

speaker: AARON
text_entry: The close enacts and counsels of the heart!

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Here's a young lad framed of another leer:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Look, how the black slave smiles upon the father,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: As who should say 'Old lad, I am thine own.'

speaker: AARON
text_entry: He is your brother, lords, sensibly fed

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Of that self-blood that first gave life to you,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And from that womb where you imprison'd were

speaker: AARON
text_entry: He is enfranchised and come to light:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Nay, he is your brother by the surer side,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Although my seal be stamped in his face.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Aaron, what shall I say unto the empress?

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Advise thee, Aaron, what is to be done,

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: And we will all subscribe to thy advice:

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Save thou the child, so we may all be safe.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Then sit we down, and let us all consult.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: My son and I will have the wind of you:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Keep there: now talk at pleasure of your safety.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: They sit

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: How many women saw this child of his?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Why, so, brave lords! when we join in league,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: I am a lamb: but if you brave the Moor,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: The chafed boar, the mountain lioness,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: The ocean swells not so as Aaron storms.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: But say, again; how many saw the child?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Cornelia the midwife and myself;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: And no one else but the deliver'd empress.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: The empress, the midwife, and yourself:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Two may keep counsel when the third's away:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Go to the empress, tell her this I said.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: He kills the nurse

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Weke, weke! so cries a pig prepared to the spit.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: What mean'st thou, Aaron? wherefore didst thou this?

speaker: AARON
text_entry: O Lord, sir, 'tis a deed of policy:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Shall she live to betray this guilt of ours,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: A long-tongued babbling gossip? no, lords, no:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And now be it known to you my full intent.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Not far, one Muli lives, my countryman;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: His wife but yesternight was brought to bed;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: His child is like to her, fair as you are:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Go pack with him, and give the mother gold,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And tell them both the circumstance of all;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And how by this their child shall be advanced,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And be received for the emperor's heir,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And substituted in the place of mine,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: To calm this tempest whirling in the court;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And let the emperor dandle him for his own.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Hark ye, lords; ye see I have given her physic,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Pointing to the nurse

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And you must needs bestow her funeral;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: The fields are near, and you are gallant grooms:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: This done, see that you take no longer days,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: But send the midwife presently to me.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: The midwife and the nurse well made away,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Then let the ladies tattle what they please.

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: Aaron, I see thou wilt not trust the air

speaker: CHIRON
text_entry: With secrets.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: For this care of Tamora,

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Herself and hers are highly bound to thee.

speaker: DEMETRIUS
text_entry: Exeunt DEMETRIUS and CHIRON bearing off the Nurse's body

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Now to the Goths, as swift as swallow flies;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: There to dispose this treasure in mine arms,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And secretly to greet the empress' friends.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Come on, you thick lipp'd slave, I'll bear you hence;

speaker: AARON
text_entry: For it is you that puts us to our shifts:

speaker: AARON
text_entry: I'll make you feed on berries and on roots,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And feed on curds and whey, and suck the goat,

speaker: AARON
text_entry: And cabin in a cave, and bring you up

speaker: AARON
text_entry: To be a warrior, and command a camp.

speaker: AARON
text_entry: Exit
